result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Mccray

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Mccray appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for James Mccray.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
DPA hearing held. Court begins plea colloquy with the defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court adjourns the matter for defendant to appear in person. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant James Mccray appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for James Mccray.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing . Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James Mccray in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer fom the state. Court adjourns matter for an additional Scheduling Conference date to Br 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James Mccray in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Matthew Plummer, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RCM (DOB 11/2/02) AND her family.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant James Mccray in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant James Mccray in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Mccray appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, branch 29.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
